text: Thomas Curtis Hills (1884-1963), was an English bowls player who competed in three British Empire Games. ==Bowls career== At the 1930 British Empire Games he won the gold medal in the pairs event with George Wright. The pair repeated the success four years later at the 1934 British Empire Games. He also competed at the 1938 British Empire Games in the singles, where he finished fourth. ==Personal Life== He was an auctioneer and estate agent by trade and married Beatrice Nellie Foster, they lived in Lewisham. ==References== Category:English male bowls players Category:Bowls players at the 1930 British Empire Games Category:Bowls players at the 1934 British Empire Games Category:Bowls players at the 1938 British Empire Games Category:Commonwealth Games gold medallists for England Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in lawn bowls Category:1884 births Category:1963 deaths
